data.title: Average at best
data.text: It's hard to find a sushi restaurant in this area that even tries to offer anything imaginative, anything other than the pedestrian/fast food type sushi. Pre made frozen spring rolls, bland and cold edamame. The service was rather lackluster and our food took a while to come out.  They brought out my wives food a good ten minutes before the rest of ours. Unimpressed.

data.title: Green beans in garlic was excellent
data.text:
The Thai dish I had was excellent. Green beans with chicken and a light spicy garlic sauce bursting with flavor.
I will go back for sure.

data.title: Decent prices / bad service
data.text: I have eaten in the lounge a few times during happy hour and have not been impressed with the service. service.AAverage time to

data.title: Quality of Take-Out
data.text: We ordered a sushi roll, unagi, Pad Thai, and green tea teriyaki chicken stir fry for take-out.  The roll was average and the unagi the chewiest I've ever had.  The Pad Thai was a giant clump of broad rice noodles all stuck together and the teriyaki chicken was overcooked with a very thin teriyaki sauce served on a bed of the smallest amount of sliced carrot, broccoli, and cabbage I have ever seen in a stir fry.  Even if I had picked it up from an affordable food cart I would have been disappointed.

data.title: Tasty Sushi
data.text:
Shiki's a stylishly appointed Japanese and Thai Restaurant. The Sushi was very good with a wide variety available. My husband had the pepper steak which was a little too salty.

We enjoyed our sushi very much, our waitress, Rebecca was friendly and attentive.

data.title: Good service and decent menu
data.text:
We went to Shiki's for a Saturday night dinner. It was not crowded when we arrived at about 6:30, and we were seated promptly. Our server got to us in a few minutes. We had some dietary concerns, and the server, who was very friendly, took the time to check with the chef about various menu items.

Unfortunately, the chef was not able to prepare any of the stir-fry dishes without wheat or soy, but we were able to settle on one of the curries and a salmon dish. They were very gracious in substituting and adding extra vegetable, The food was good, but not stupendous. 

Overall a pleasant dining experience.

data.title: One of the best in the valley!
data.text: I love Sushi and I've very particular about the quality and this place never disappoints. I see that other reviewers have mentioned bad service but I have not had this same experience. Occasionally there is only one wait person and great sushi always takes time but everyone I have ever had has been kind and sweet and super helpful. I highly recommend.

data.title: Good food, horrid service
data.text: Went the Shiki's for the first time on a business lunch.  It took 10 minutes for Waiter #1 to arrive with water, and then took our orders.  With only 4 other tables in the entire restaurant, we became concerned after 45 minutes and we still didn't have our food, but an unoccupied table nearby had four different meals sitting without patrons .  Three of us ordered a "box meal" and the 4th member of our party ordered a stir fry, and I had to wave down a different  waiter in the kitchen to enquire as to whether there was an issue with our order.  Waiter 1 told Waiter 2 to talk to me.  This young man brought our food, telling  us "It takes longer to make the box meal."  All 4 of us received box meals, even though one order was for a stir fry.  Thankfully, the food was good.  Start to finish, we were there an hour and a half, so this is not a good place to go if you want to get in and out quickly.  The food was quite tasty, but they definitely need to improve their service.

data.title: Hello?
data.text: Another party in addition to ours waited for approximately 5 minutes before staff even approached us to seat us on an evening that was not busy.  The sushi chef could see us standing there but he couldn't seat us because of his work and almost appeared distraught that no one was assisting us.  The 2 waitresses that catered to our needs were both friendly but absent throughout the meal.  It took another 10-12 minutes to take our order after drinks arrived.  The food makes up for it.  I often drive-by this restaurant and I knew the food had to be good.  We had all sushi and the specialty rolls were excellent.  I highly recommend the LAS VEGAS ROLL.  It has jalapeno and genuinely perfect flavor profile.  Come for the food, not the service.

data.title: Came for sushi
data.text: From out of town and was recommended by a friend to come here. we had great service. The sushi menu is huge! The rolls were fresh and made extremely fast. Next time we  are in town we will definitely be coming here again.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Great spot for lunch or dinner, service is good and the sushi is outstanding. Took our 14 year old recently (his choice) and tried new and different types of sushi - octopus being the most notable! Rice bowls and curries for lunch are always a hit and they will even spice it up for us!

data.title: Great sushi!
data.text: Were came for dinner on the advice of friends not knowing what to expect.  The place was very pleasant and our waitress was nice.  We ordered a glass of Chardonnay but were told that were out of their house wine so we said that we would buy a bottle.  After a very long wait the waitress told they she had been looking everywhere and could not find bottle of Chardonnay anywhere in the restaurant!  We thought this was odd but settled on a glass of red. We ordered 3 sushi rolls and they were wonderful.  They had a guitarist who was very good too. We will be back but not order Chardonnay.

data.title: Fresh Sushi, Tempura, Stir fry and much more!
data.text: Friday night out for an early dinner with my husband.  This place had something for us both.  Not only can you get some fresh sushi, but the tempura and stir fry was awesome.  We even had a salad that the dressing made us both eat it all... then to top of the night we split a fried banana with honey... excellent evening, staff friendly and attentive!

data.title: Worst service ever
data.text: Waitress was unable to produce a smile. We ordered 8 rolls, and after the 6th one was given to us, she asked if we wanted our check. The rolls were nothing special, and lacked freshness. Save your money people!

data.title: Terrible service
data.text: Thursday night - three sets of customers at tables. Got seated and given menus. Waited 20 minutes without asking if we wanted drinks or taking our order so we left. Waiter lackadaisical - walked very slowly around restaurant dragging his feet. Went to Chinese down the road and got instant service.

data.title: Lovin' Shiki
data.text: This is one of our new favorite places! And in our top two sushi spots! The volcano rolls are ah-mazing! We can't decide which one we like best, the shrimp or lobster. So we just keep getting both! And...their coconut martinis are to die for! Love the atmosphere, and also love the live music on weekends. Just an all around great place to go!

data.title: Top Notch
data.text: Our first visit to Shiki's and it definitely wont be the last. Service was prompt and friendly...food excellent. Great selection with something for everyone's taste. If you like spicy the Langostina roll is superb with just the right amount of bite.  What else can I say except...well be back!

data.title: Find Nemo in the aquarium!
data.text: Your greeted when you walk in. The aquarium has fish from Disney's "Finding Nemo" in it. The atmosphere is calm and relaxing. The sushi bar is warm and inviting and very fresh. I had the orange chicken with rice. Its crisp, fresh, hot and very delicious. The pot stickers were hot and fresh. The Thai iced tea very good although a bit on the sweet side. Over all a very good fast friendly and relaxing place to eat!

data.title: They MOVED but the Volcano Roll is still to die for!
data.text: They moved over to the Old Red Rock building just north of Porters.  Awesome atmosphere in their new location!   Great food for sure!  Every meal so far is fresh and flavorful!  Henry the bar tender is the BOMB at the making cocktails!  Live Music on most Friday nights!  Enjoy!

data.title: favorite sushi place in Medford
data.text: I love it, good prices and always good food and service.  My friend is what I would call a sushi snob and he likes it here as well.
